oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Rick Riman tapes - tape 3 of 5 - Side one channel one
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Bluegrass performances collected by Rick Riman. Clarence and Roland White with band from the Ash Grove club in Los Angeles, California circa 1972. Continued on side two. Audio restricted. Contact for access.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Clarence White; Roland White; Bernie Leadon; Herb Pederson; Roger Bush;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:05) Fire On The Mountain / (01:43) I Might Take You Back Again / (03:47) Farewell Blues / (06:20) Blue and Lonesome / (08:55) Footprints In The Snow / (11:42) Lonesome Moonlight Waltz / (14:35) Ruby (Are You Mad At Your Man) - incomplete / (16:01) Why You Been Gone So Long - abrupt start / (19:18) He Said If I Be Lifted Up / (22:12) Rawhide / (25:12) New River Train - abrupt start / (28:32) Used To Be (Eric White on bass and lead vocal) - abrupt start / (31:27) Louisiana Man (incomplete) / (32:17) Program end / (42:17) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Hand written content notes on paper inserted in tape box.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: White, Clarence, 1944-1973; White, Roland; Leadon, Bernie; Pederson, Herb; Bush, Roger; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
